name: Seldom-Heard Songs from the 70s & 80s #1 Quiz | Music | 15 Questions

questions.explanation:
Jimmy Davis and the Junction.

	The Junction was a band out of Memphis, Tennessee, whose lead vocalist was ex-Riverbluff Clan founding member, Jimmy Davis. The song only got as high as number 67 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart in 1987.

EBN OZN.

	Robert Rosen (OZN) and Ned Liben (EBN) formed the duo, EBN OZN, inthe early 1980's. They had a minor hit on the R&B chart with "AEIOU Sometimes Y" in 1983 before charting with "Bag Lady" at number 36 on the Billboard Hot 100 Club Chart, in 1984.

questions.text: Which one of these groups sang the song, "Black Betty"?
questions.explanation:
Ram Jam.

	This group was formed in New York City and featured former Lemon Pipers member, Bill Bartlett, on guitar. The song went to number 18 on the pop chart in 1977.

questions.text: The group, The Truth, sang which one of these songs?
options: Saturday Night Love, Sunday Morning Heartache
questions.explanation:
Weapons of Love.

	Initially a R&B band, The Truth sang, "Weapons of Love", which topped out at number 65 in 1986. This was a dramatic swtich from their early R&B roots to the synch/pop sound of the 1980's and it ended up costing the group their fan base.

questions.text: Which of these groups sang the song, "Hot Summer Nights"?
questions.explanation:
Night.

	Night was a five-man, one female pop/rock group that featured the former lead singer of Manfred Mann's Earth Band, Chris Thompson, on vocals and future Pretender and Paul McCartney backing band member, Robbie McIntosh, on guitar. The song went to number 18 on the pop chart in 1979.

questions.text: What is the missing word in this lyric, "_______ of the airwaves, here is my request. You don't have to play it, but I hope you do your best"?
questions.explanation:
Pilot.

	Charlie Dore, a female singer/songwriter from London, asked the "Pilot of the Airwaves" to play her request in 1980. The song peaked at number 13 on the pop chart.

questions.text: "So Wrong" was a top 40 hit for which of these Doobie Brothers in 1983?
questions.explanation:
Patrick Simmons.

	An original member of the Doobie Brothers, Patrick Simmons had this modest hit song that peaked at number 30 on the pop chart during the group's disbanding in 1983. He helped to re-form the band in 1988.

questions.text: What is the title of the song containing these lyrics, "A room full of faceless strangers, here I am again. Suddenly my eyes meet yours, looks like I've found a friend."?
questions.explanation:
Cool  Love.

	Pablo Cruise, a band formed in San Francisco, went to number 13 with "Cool Love", in 1981 with this song.

questions.text: What is the word that belongs in this seldom heard song from 1976, "When I wake up, in the morning light, I pull my blue _____ on. I pull my old, blue _____ on"?
questions.explanation:
jeans.

	David Dundas pulled on his old blue jeans in this song, 'Jeans On', that went to number 1 in the fall of 1976.

questions.text: Which one of these groups had a top 10 re-make of the song, 'Funky Town", in 1987?
questions.explanation:
Pseudo Echo.

	Pseudo Echo was from Melbourne, Australia. They went to number 6 in 1987 with a re-make of Lipps, Inc.'s, "Funky Town", which had gone to number 1 in 1980 and enjoyed a four week stay.

questions.text: The song "Street Corner Serenade" was a top 20 hit for The Michael Stanley Band in 1981?
questions.explanation:
False.

	"Street Corner Serenade" was done by Wet Willie,a rock/pop group from Alabama, in 1977. The song peaked at number 30 in 1978.

questions.text: In the Sniff 'N the Tears song, "Driver's Seat", what was the name of the girl the group said was "so sweet"?
questions.explanation:
Jenny.

	Jenny was the girl who was so sweet in the song in 1977. The song sped up the charts, but stalled and peaked at number 15 in 1979.

questions.text: What is the name of the song that has these lyrics, "Save my life, I'm going down for the last time. Woman with the sweet loving, better than a white line"?
questions.explanation:
Never Been Any Reason.

	Head East pushed this song, "Never Been Any Reason", only as high as number 68 on the pop chart in 1975; however, it has become a staple on many classic rock stations.

questions.text: What is the name of the person whom Elton John names in this song, "And I feel like a bullet in the gun of ______________. I'm low as a paid assassin is, you know I'm as cold as a hired sword"?
questions.explanation:
Robert Ford.

	Robert Ford, a member of the Jeese James outlaw gang, made a deal with the governor of Missouri to kill Jesse James and collect the reward money for himself. On April 3, 1882, Ford held up his end of the deal by shooting James in the back of his head while visiting with him in James' home. Ford was arrested, tried, convicted, and sentenced to death for the deed, however, the governor did honor his part of the deal, also, and Ford was released two days before he was scheduled to die, receiving his reward as promised.As for the song, while it was on the "B" side of "Grow Some Funk of Your Own", it received just as much airplay and peaked at number 14 on the pop chart in 1975 at the same time as the "A" side did.

questions.text: Lets close out with the Bee Gees, what is the name the song that contains these lyrics, "She came on like the night, and she held on tight. And the world was right when she made love to me. We were free"?
options: Fanny Be Tender With My Love
questions.explanation:
Love So Right.

	"Love So Right" went to number 3 in 1976 for the brothers Gibb.
